title: SCS ADVT 370-CN-16 Introduction to Public Relations

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Public relations is a core management function for every type of organization, whether public or private. Public relations spans a wide range of marketing disciplines including media relations, corporate reputation, community affairs, issues/crisis management, investor relations, and government affairs. PR is one of the primary tools used to reinforce a company's brand and support its competitive position. Students learn the essential components of an effective PR strategy; how to evaluate and manage outside PR counsel; essentials of media relations and crisis management; and how to draft PR messages. Students select a "beat" or coverage area to investigate as part of the class homework projects. This course involves heavy writing; it may not be audited.This course is cross-listed as MKTG 390-CN.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: This course is cross-listed with MKTG 390: Topics in Marketing - Intro to PR.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
To provide students with a basic overview of the PR discipline; its core practices; and how PR is used as a strategic communications tool for organizations.

Learning outcomes:

- Understanding how PR fits into an organization's business strategy
- Familiarity with the primary components involved in executing a PR initiative
- Ability to recognize various stakeholder groups involved/impacted by a decision
- Basic competency in press release writing and other media outreach tools
